benchmark_details.name: iMiGUE
benchmark_details.overview: The iMiGUE dataset consists of video footage of tennis players during post-match interviews, with detailed frame-level annotations of various micro-gestures. The dataset contains 72 subjects and a total of 33 gesture classes.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The primary objective of the iMiGUE dataset is to facilitate understanding of micro-gestures and their relationship to emotional states.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The class distribution is highly imbalanced, with 28 of the 33 classes being tail classes with relatively few samples.

data.source: iMiGUE dataset collected from videos of tennis players

methods: Evaluation of model performance using Top-1 accuracy
methodology.calculation: Top-1 accuracy is calculated as the percentage of correctly classified gestures over total classifications.
methodology.interpretation: High accuracy indicates good performance in recognizing micro-gestures.
methodology.baseline_results: Top-1 accuracy of CLIP-MG model is 61.82%.
methodology.validation: Local validation set was created by setting aside 20% of the training data.
